result.execSummary:
The defendant Dameon Duprey Payton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT WITH EACH OTHER; AS TO BOTH COUNTS, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: EACH COUNT: Provide DNA sample (unless previously done); pay surcharge. Pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges including restitution surcharge to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION; AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
- No Contact with the victims.
- Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
- Cooperate and participate with any other programming deemed appropriate by the Probation Department and follow any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dameon Duprey Payton

Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (21 pages) commencing JULY 24, 2015 received and filed. kl
Added consecutive to prison sentence

Defendant Dameon Duprey Payton in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Dameon Duprey Payton in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 42 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, concurrent to Count #2, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 42 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, concurrent to Count #1, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with any other programming deemed appropriate by the Probation Department and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $4,435.00 payable to UW Credit Union.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Crime Victim Impact Statement with attached Restitution Worksheet.

Defendant Dameon Duprey Payton in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Dameon Duprey Payton in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Dameon Duprey Payton not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request another Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

ADA Sarah McNutt appeared on behalf of the state.  Defendant, Dameon Deprey Payton, not in court; in custody.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW) INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
